thread.title: H.S. football: A look back at games Oct. 16-17
thread.title_full: H.S. football: A look back at games Oct. 16-17

title: H.S. football: A look back at games Oct. 16-17
text:
H.S. football: A look back at games Oct. 16-17 October 19, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 19, 2015, 1:20 AM The Record Pages: 1 2 > display on one page 
* Senior RB Roddy Acuna carried eight times for 110 yards and three TDs as Bergen Tech beat Morrisville (Pa.), 40-14. The Knights have won three straight and eight of their last nine. 
* Senior CB/RB TJ Green intercepted three passes for Boonton in a 28-9 victory over Whippany Park. Green rushed for 70 yards and a TD on 10 attempts. Senior QB Gage Cabalar led the Bombers’ offense with 169 rushing yards and two TDs on 23 carries. 
* Butler extended its winning streak to four by topping Hopatcong, 34-13. Senior WR/RB/CB Dan Castiglia caught six passes for 166 yards and three TDs, rushed for a score, and intercepted two passes for the Bulldogs. Freshman RB Sean Centinaro added 94 rushing yards and a TD on 12 carries. 
* Dwight Morrow sophomore QB Andrew Jones threw for a career-high 300 yards to go with three TDs during a 57-24 loss to River Dell. Jones has thrown for 878 yards and nine TDs in five games. 
* Eastside senior LB Armon Kelly recorded seven tackles, two of which went for losses, and a sack to help the Ghosts beat Passaic, 24-7. Junior FS Ramir Tann-Davis intercepted a pass for Eastside. 
* Senior LB Matt Lange had six tackles and senior DL James Antolino had seven as Glen Rock beat Lyndhurst, 42-35, for its fifth straight win. Lange leads Glen Rock with 43 tackles in six games, one more than Antolino. 
* Senior DEs Winston Solomon (eight tackles, sack, forced fumble) and Justin Vick (nine tackles, two sacks), and junior DT Camal Brown (sack, fumble return for a TD) were among the defensive standouts that helped Hackensack shut out Fair Lawn, 26-0. 
* Matt DiChiara provided a tremendous defensive effort for Hasbrouck Heights in its 42-28 win over St. Mary. The junior LB had five tackles, two for losses, and shared two sacks. He also recovered two fumbles and batted down two passes. 
* Hudson Catholic has six straight shutouts. A New Jersey high school football team hasn’t gone unbeaten and unscored upon in a season since Lodi in 1938. 
* Mahwah has posted three straight shutouts and has not allowed a point in 14 quarters. 
* Keep an eye on New Milford junior RB Christian Correa. He ran for a career-high 223 yards in a 33-14 defeat of Harrison. That performance gave him 738 yards and seven TDs in six games. 
* Senior QB/CB Danny Mullin made a big impact on both sides of the ball for Lakeland in its 35-14 win against Passaic Valley. Mullin completed 9 of 10 passes for 170 yards and two TDs, and he wasn’t intercepted. He recorded eight tackles, including two for losses, and recovered a fumble. 
* Senior RB Axel Fuentes carried 12 times for 131 yards and two TDs in the first half as North Bergen beat Kearny, 43-0. North Bergen improved to 3-3 and has won three of its last four games. The Bruins have averaged 37.8 points during that four-game span. 
* Paramus coach Dan Sabella confirmed that sophomore QB Christopher Gass left the Spartans’ 17-7 loss to Ridgewood in the second quarter with an elbow injury. Gass’ availability for a home game against eighth-ranked Wayne Hills on Friday night is unknown. Gass became the Spartans’ starter when senior Chris Regalbuto suffered season-ending fractures to his leg during a 31-14 loss at Wayne Valley on Sept. 25. 
* Junior LB Zach Toback (17 tackles, one for a loss), senior LB Matt Forrest (11 tackles, sack), senior LB Jake Kershaw (eight tackles, one for a loss) and senior DT Johanser Joseph (seven tackles, one for a loss) were defensive standouts for Pequannock in its fourth straight win, a 20-7 victory over Kinnelon. Sophomore RB Sean Klimek rushed for 144 yards and a TD on 14 carries, and senior QB Tommy Crooks completed 8 of 12 passes for 93 yards and rushed for a pair of scores. 
* Pascack Valley’s loss to NV/Old Tappan made River Dell’s seven-game winning streak the longest in North Jersey. 
* Sophomore WR Danny Romero’s 73-yard TD reception from senior QB Griffin Peene was the longest completion for Ridgewood since 1998. Peene put the ball right on the money some 30 yards downfield and Romero beat two defenders to the end zone. 
* St. Joseph junior LB Louis Acceus had five tackles and two sacks despite playing only two quarters of a 44-12 win over Silver Oak (Md.) Academy. He has a team-high 53 tackles and four sacks in six games. 
* Waldwick/Midland Park rushed for 372 yards on 52 attempts and recorded 22 first downs during its 50-43 loss to Garfield. Senior RB Brett Calderone led the Warriors with 127 yards and a TD on 14 carries. Sophomore Sonny DiPasquale added 82 yards and two TDs on 12 attempts. 
* Senior RB Luca Grave rushed for 152 yards and four TDs on 13 carries to spark Wayne Hills’ 44-2 win over Teaneck. Grave has gained 785 rushing yards and scored 12 TDs on 85 carries in seven games. 
* Wayne Valley junior QB Grant Ferrauilo made the most of his first varsity start in a 41-13 defeat of Northern Highlands. Ferrauilo, who started for injured senior Nick Goodwin (foot), completed 15 of 21 passes for 136 yards and two TDs, and ran for a TD. Senior TE Ryan Monteyne caught two passes for 36 yards and a TD. Monteyne has caught at least one TD pass in five of Wayne Valley’s six games this season, and is the team’s leading receiver (15 catches, 299 yards, six TDs). © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
